activity: Grand opening of the natural playground
quote: Any gathering that is open to our community is an important way to foster good will in the community.
It has led to more people, including children, participating by playing music or singing. It has brought people together so they get to know each other better.

Unique to this event was the opportunity to get to know neighbours from surrounding streets - people whom we knew to see as they walked down our street and now we had a chance to say hello and become acquainted. Reiterates the supports we provide to each other including a wonderful sense of community.

We now have a new gathering area in our community.  We are looking forward to using this area at least once a month from March to October.  The group is small but enthusiastic and already new friendships are developing through it.

activity: Planting food forest in Victoria Park.
quote: The food forest will add to the diversity of trees and plants already in the park. In addition, the food forest provides free, healthy food for the taking.
One family in particular joined us for the first time - allowing us the chance to make introductions with other neighbours. New connections!
Helps neighbours connect to one another. Helps people see the park is a great gathering/meeting space at all times of the day/year.
The Stanley Park Community Association provided the film and snacks. A trip to a commercial movie theatre for a family of four can be very pricey.

activity: Holiday Potluck and Annual General Meeting.
quote: Anytime we can bring neighbours together, especially in a casual event (with food!), neighbourhood connections are strengthened.

Many people connect with the church congregation, whether just for the day, or for a longer period of time. Friendships are sparked, and families are introduced to the social services offered by the church.

Gave neighbours a chance to connect, especially over the winter when we tend to hide out in our houses. It allowed the neighbourhood to connect with some recently arrived refugee children from Reception House.

We plan to make a huge gathering, invite everyone in the building to join su, meet and greet and party, so we can recognize everyone living with us, and knowing that we are all neighbours who care for each other.
Some people visited the community centre for the first time, met others in their neighbourhood and enjoyed a fun activity.
Our little slice of downtown Kitchener pie desires to engage neighbours in meaningful connections to build a strong community where each member feels known and valued.
We hold a neighbourhood potluck everyÂ Wednesday. We have been doing this for years. It is a wonderful way to engage neighbours.

This was really exciting! With the help of FON, we were expecting maybe 10 -15 participants. Our final tally was around 40 people. Parents were excited to attend an event close to their home and there is talk about other events that we can organize!
Removal of litter makes the neighborhood more appealing to view.

activity: Annual Earth Day Community Clean up
quote: Had approx 35 people come out and clean up along the trail and pond between Janine cresent and Fairway road. 18 bags of garbage collected in approx 1 hour. Met some new families and reconnected with former connections.

activity: Annual Earth Day Community Clean up
quote: Had approx 35 people come out and clean up along the trail and pond between janine cres and fairway road. 18 bags of garbage collected in approx 1 hour. Met some new families and reconnected with former connections.

This gathering was the kick-starter our neighbourhood needed to revitalize our association's social/community events. The overwhelming support of this event is the added motivation we needed to plan and promote other neighbourly events!

Finally came face to face with neighbors. I feel as though I opened the door for further opportunities to host small events for our neighborhood friends. I feel as though we have all connected on a deeper level and will look out for each other.

activity: Earth Day -Parkvale Park Street Clean up
quote: Brought awareness to the community that littering is unacceptable and we need to do our part in maintaining the area. Keep it safe and a desirable place to live.
Yes the clean up would help the environment and definitely made an improvement in our neighbourhood. We collected 60 bags of garbage!
We keep in touch with one another and know our neighbours names, and strengths.
Environmentally conscious activity for our community.
This activity is using DANCE to transform King East neighbourhood for a magical weekend!
This activity is using the warmth and generosity of our community to help support our neighbours who need it most.

activity: KENA and Central Frederick Garden Swap and Sale
quote: Had approx 35 people come out and clean up along the trail and pond between Janine crescent and Fairway road. 18 bags of garbage collected in approx 1 hour. Met some new families and reconnected with former connections.

activity: Neighbours Day Celebration and Garage Sale

quote: More awareness of the Victoria Park food forest and sharing of resources, community gardening tips, reducing waste, etc.
